column4: how do i get access to the source code, change it, and resubmit it for approval?
to get the source code, "apt-get source <packagename>". to change it, well, just change it. to build it, look at dpkg-buildpackage. as for submitting it, perhaps ask in #ubuntu-motu
in the directory you type that apt-get command in
i have no idea. i poked him, and he didn't give an explanation, so...
wasn't that a reasonable q? Expecting windows progs to work on ubuntu is like trying to hammer a nail with a screwdriver.
that's not necessarily a bad thing.
because there are a few programs that can't run on 64bit. i think probably most of the people who have a 64bit processor are really using 32bit Ubuntu
right, but surely the system would run faster using the correct kernel for its architecture?
so i'll keep it as it is for now.  but just for my information, an AMD turion 64 x2 technically should be using the 64-bit version, yeah?
ok, i take your point.  Thanks for the advice LjL :)
any 64 bit processor can use the 32 bit version - the vice versa is not true. yours is a 64 bit processor
